key_title: Key to the subspecies of Euphrasia collina

Key to the families of Dicotyledons

Key to the species of Euphrasia

source.author: Barker, W.R.
source.title: Scrophulariaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Barker, W.R. (1999). Scrophulariaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: External surface of the calyx glabrous (except sometimes for a small area just below the median clefts)
External surface of calyx extensively (but sometimes very shortly) hairy
Lower corolla-lobes externally glabrous (best seen by glabrous exposed part of corolla in bud), emarginate; rear anther awns 0.1–0.5 mm long; seeds 0.5–1.0 mm long
Lower corolla-lobes externally hairy usually all over or along midline, rarely at base only

Upper leaves of main inflorescence-bearing branches 1.5–4.4 mm wide, with 0–2 (usually 1) pair(s) of teeth confined to distal half; lower corolla-lobes usually emarginate to truncate, rarely obtuse; rear anther awns 0.2–0.6 mm long

Upper leaves of main inflorescence-bearing branches 2.4–8.0 mm wide, with 1–6 (usually 1–3) pairs of teeth confined to the distal fifth to almost the entire length of the leaf; lower corolla-lobes usually obtuse or truncate, rarely emarginate; rear anther awns 0.15–0.4 mm long
Bracts and external surface of calyx covered by eglandular hairs
Bracts and external surface of calyx with glandular hairs, sometimes mixed with eglandular hairs
Main inflorescence-bearing branches bearing branches or shoots to high above ground-level; glandular hairs on calyx up to 0.1, rarely 0.2 mm long; rear anther awns 0.1–0.5 mm long
Main inflorescence-bearing branches with branches or shoots confined to basal parts
Glandular hairs on external surface of calyx up to 0.1 (–0.15) mm long
Glandular hairs on external surface of calyx at least (0.05–) 0.1–0.2 mm long
Glands on external surface of calyx clearly stalked, 0.05–0.1 (–0.15) mm long
Glands on external surface of calyx subsessile, up to 0.05 mm long
Seeds (0.9–) 1.1–1.9 mm long; anthers 1.7–3.0 mm long, with rear awns (0.25–) 0.3–0.5 (–0.6) mm long
Seeds 0.4–0.9 (–1.0) mm long; anthers 1.3–2.2 mm long, with rear awns (0.1–) 0.2–0.3 (–0.4) mm long
